Docs.summary: Exposes the public members of the class to unmanaged code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
This interface preserves the vtable order of the <xref:System.Exception?displayProperty=fullName> class members that can be accessed by unmanaged COM objects.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The to compare with the current .
Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the method.
Docs.returns: if the specified is equal to the current ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method determines whether the specified <xref:System.Object> is equal to the current <xref:System.Object>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Exception GetBaseException() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the method.
Docs.returns: The first exception thrown in a chain of exceptions. If the property of the current exception is a null reference ( in Visual Basic), this property returns the current exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.GetBaseException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method returns the <xref:System.Exception> that is the root cause of one or more subsequent exceptions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the method.
Docs.returns: The hash code for the current instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method serves as a hash function for a particular type. <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GetObjectData(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The structure that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the method

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.GetObjectData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method sets the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> object with information about the exception.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Type GetType() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the method.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the exact runtime type of the current instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.GetType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method gets the runtime type of the current instance.

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the property.
Docs.value: The Uniform Resource Name (URN) or Uniform Resource Locator (URL) to a help file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.HelpLink%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets or sets a link to the help file associated with this exception.

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the property.
Docs.value: An instance of that describes the error that caused the current exception. The property returns the same value that was passed to the constructor, or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if the inner exception value was not supplied to the constructor. This property is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets the <xref:System.Exception> instance that caused the current exception.

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the property.
Docs.value: The error message that explains the reason for the exception, or an empty string("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets a message that describes the current exception.

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the property.
Docs.value: The name of the application or the object that causes the error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.Source%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets or sets the name of the application or the object that causes the error.

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the property.
Docs.value: A string that describes the contents of the call stack, with the most recent method call appearing first.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.StackTrace%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets a string representation of the frames on the call stack at the time the current exception was thrown.

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the property.
Docs.value: The object that threw the current exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.TargetSite%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets the method that throws the current exception.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the method.
Docs.returns: A string that represents the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Exception.ToString%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method creates and returns a string representation of the current exception.
